content: Among the projects received during the month of October, are two large capital awards, these projects, which will be included in our second quarter backlog include a second large-scale specialty vessel of similar size and scope as that received in the first quarter and the upgrade of an existing LNG Peak Shaving facility for a large public utility located in the Mid-Atlantic region which was recently announced by press release. In Utility and Power Infrastructure, revenue was $44.9 million which was lower than previous quarters as we are in the final completion stages of a couple of Peak Shaving projects that are carrying low margins. And finally, in Storage and Terminal Solutions, which produced the strongest results for the quarter, revenue increased to $76.9 million related to LNG and other capital projects.
